oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Kentucky Spring Poll Survey, 1993
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Survey Research Center, University of Kentucky
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Survey Research Center, University of Kentucky
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Taxes (State)
Child care
Environment
Computer technology
Omnibus and Public Opinion
Public Opinion Poll
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This statewide survey focuses on life in Kentucky, President and Governor ratings, Toyota, and state taxes. Additional variables include drug usage among women, child custody, mediation, consumer protection, Government services, news and media, pesticides, poultry, and chemicals.

Citation: Survey Research Center, University of Kentucky, 1996, "Kentucky Spring Poll Survey, 1993", http://hdl.handle.net/1902.29/D-30917 Odum Institute;Odum Institute for Research in Social Science, University of North Carolina [Distributor] V1 [Version]

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Harris 1995 Happiness Poll Survey, study no. 953002
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Louis Harris and Associates, Inc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Happiness
Exercise
Religion
Lifestyle
Omnibus and Public Opinion Polls
Public Opinion Poll
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This survey focuses on the respondent's perception of their happiness. Questions included personal rating of happiness, comparison with others, factors that influence personal happiness, role of religion, change in current lifestyle for happiness, exercise, and control of happiness.

Citation: Louis Harris and Associates, Inc., 1996, "Harris 1995 Happiness Poll Survey, study no. 953002", http://hdl.handle.net/1902.29/H-953002 Odum Institute;Odum Institute for Research in Social Science [Distributor] V1 [Version]

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Harris 1978 survey on preventive health, study no. 2818
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Louis Harris and Associates, Inc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Health
Insurance
Preventive health care
Omnibus and Public Opinion Studies
Health
Public Opinion Poll
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
This survey focuses health care and what the respondent, physician, employers, health insurance industry, or government can do to prevent illness

Variables include preventive medicine, weight problems, exercise, nutrition, hypertension, mental health, stress, smoking, drinking, cost of health care, and preventing the need for health care

oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Louis Harris and Associates, Inc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Omnibus and Public Opinion
Public Opinion Poll
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This study focuses on the potential for non-stop, round-the-clock worldwide trading. Interviews were conducted with top executives at leading financial institutions in the U.S., the U.K. and Japan.

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Rhode Island Survey, 1989
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: A. Alfred Taubman Center for Public Policy and American Institutions. Brown University
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: John Hazen White Public Opinion Laboratory, A. Alfred Taubman Center for Public Policy and American Institutions, Brown University
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Rhode Island
Economic Development
Oil Spill
Auto Insurance
Abortion
Omnibus and Public Opinion
Public Opinion Poll
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This statewide survey focussed on issues related to Rhode Island residents' concerns about the economy and abortion. Other variables measures satisfaction regarding national and state politicians, oil spill and auto insurance. Standard demographic variables were also included.

Citation: A. Alfred Taubman Center for Public Policy and American Institutions. Brown University, 1989, "The Rhode Island Survey, 1989", http://hdl.handle.net/1902.29/D-31082 Odum Institute [Distributor] V1 [Version]

oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Economy
Business
Inflation
Omnibus Public Opinion Studies
Public Opinion Poll

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Georgia State Poll, Summer 1996
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Applied Research Center, Georgia State University
oai_dc:dc.dc:publisher: Applied Research Center, Georgia State University
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crime
Presidential Elections
Olympic Games
Omnibus and Public Opinion Studies
Public Opinion Poll
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Georgia State Poll is a mechanism for state agencies, academic researchers and non profit organizations to collect data on topics of interest while sharing the cost of the survey. A core set of demographic questions is always asked, and most polls also include performance ratings for political figures. This survey collected responses from Georgia residents on various issues. These include Bill Clinton, the Presidential election, Whitewater, juvenile crime, and the Olympic Games.
Citation: Applied Research Center, Georgia State University, 1996, "Georgia State Poll, Summer 1996", http://hdl.handle.net/1902.29/D-31410 Odum Institute [Distributor] V1 [Version]
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights:

oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Harris Study No. 15652
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Harris Interactive, Inc.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Government priorities
Political ratings
Confidence in institutions
Enron
Job satisfaction
Lifestyle satisfaction
Health behaviors
Omnibus and Public Opinion Polls
Public Opinion Poll
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Topics addressed in this study include the most important issues for the government to address, ratings of government officials, confidence in 14 institutions, Enron events, lifestyle and job satisfaction, and health behaviors including tobacco use, seat belt use, and weight. Demographic variables include respondent's sex, age, educational status, disability status, origin or descent (Spanish, Hispanic, or Latino), race, political party self identification, political philosophy, and number of individuals age 18 or over who live in the household, presence of a disabled individual age 16 or older who lives in the household, household income, and number of voice telephone lines available at home.

Citation: Harris Interactive, Inc., 2002-11, "Harris Study No. 15652", http://hdl.handle.net/1902.29/H-15652 UNF:3:XTJVbMMDiHg0LvWIfYLsiw== Odum Institute;Odum Institute for Research in Social Science, University of North Carolina [Distributor] V1 [Version]
